lines.text: That's what comes of being a bachelor all your life.

[crying]
I don't know what's the matter with me. I seem to be going to pieces!
It isn't only the body that breaks down, Jess. The mind can go too, you know.

[to Jess]
The world allows considerable liberty to wives it has never allowed to widows. I notice, for instance, you're no longer wearing black.

[to Jess]
Our kind of people wear black.
You know, it's amazing how I can learn to like martinis. It's an acquired taste like anchovies.
Then why did you bother to come here at all?
Because I was still coward enough to want to save my reputation.
There are two sides to everything - even gossip.
Can we start all over again from the beginning?
No, we cannot. I can see that you're a thorough-going scalawag, young man!
I'm delighted to hear you say so, madam.
And kindly stop calling me madam!

[to Maj. Scott Landis]
I'll never be lonely again.
